quests.passage: Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity through photovoltaic cells. This technology has become increasingly affordable and is now used in homes, businesses, and large-scale power plants worldwide.
Coral reefs support 25 percent of all marine species despite covering less than 1 percent of the ocean floor. Rising ocean temperatures threaten these vital ecosystems.
The invention of antibiotics in 1928 transformed medicine. Bacterial infections that were once fatal could now be treated effectively, saving millions of lives.
Social media has changed how people communicate. While it connects people globally, concerns about privacy and misinformation have grown significantly.
Migration patterns of birds are influenced by daylight hours, temperature, and food availability. Some species travel thousands of miles each year.
The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 18th century and spread across Europe. It fundamentally changed manufacturing, transportation, and daily life.

Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity through photovoltaic cells. This technology has become increasingly affordable and is now used in homes, businesses, and large-scale power plants worldwide.
